techmeme.title: Google says it stopped making the Chromecast after intense competition, shifting to a premium device, and views the Nvidia Shield as something to strive towards (Chris Welch/The Verge)
AI chipmaker Black Sesame drops as much as 35% on its Hong Kong trading debut, after pricing shares at the bottom of its range and raising ~$133M in its IPO (Dave Sebastian/Bloomberg)
How VP nominee Tim Walz vetoed a bill to raise minimum pay for Uber and Lyft drivers in Minnesota, before signing an updated law in May 2024 to raise pay by 20% (Andrew J. Hawkins/The Verge)
Interviews with 12 TSMC staff detail ongoing culture clashes in Arizona, as well as Japan and Germany; about 50% of the 2,200 Phoenix workers came from Taiwan (John Liu/New York Times)
Similarweb: active UK Telegram users hit 3.1M on July 29 and 3.7M on July 30 after a stabbing, as rioters turn to chat apps, up from 2.7M average in early 2024 (Financial Times)
